title: Barrels - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Cylinder head removal D71; D74; DR4; DS1; DS4; DSA; DSB; DSX

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: D74; DR4; DS4; D71; DSB; DSA; DSX; DS1

body.body: Clean the area around the barrel base gasket joint to prevent dirt falling into the crankcase when the barrels are removed.
Ensure the pistons are level with each other then break the seal of the base gasket joint.
Do not strike or lever against the barrel cooling fins to break the seal as the fins are easily damaged.
Secure the camshaft drive chain to ensure that it does not fall into the crankcase during removal of the barrels.
Support the pistons as the barrels are removed to prevent piston damage.
Lift off the barrels and recover the locating dowels.

body.name: Barrels remove refit to crankcase ciyg D Series

body.body: Remove and discard the base gasket.
